byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Benjamin Mueller, William K. Rashbaum and Nate Schweber, and research by Elisa Cho and Alain Delaquérière.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and STEPHANIE CLIFFORD

abstract: Brooklyn men Abdurasul Hasanovich Juraboev and Akhror Saidakhmetov are arrested at Kennedy International Airport and charged with plotting to travel to Syria to fight with Islamic State; third man, Abror Habibov, is also charged with aiding them; case, which rests on evidence of confidential informant, reveals how group's social media campaign to recruit young Muslims from around the world has reached New York.
lead_paragraph: One of the men was arrested early Wednesday at Kennedy International Airport, bound for Syria, the authorities said; at least two men threatened to carry out attacks in the United States.

headline.main: 3 Brooklyn Men Accused of Plot to Aid ISIS’ Fight
headline.print_headline: 3 Brooklyn Men Accused of Plot to Aid ISIS’ Fight

snippet: One of the men was arrested early Wednesday at Kennedy International Airport, bound for Syria, the authorities said; at least two men threatened to carry out attacks in the United States.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
